when_to_use: Any infant or child in actual or impending cardiac arrest, or during advanced paediatric resuscitation.

key_sections.section_title: Paediatric Arrest Recognition and Initial CPR
key_sections.summary: Identify unresponsiveness and abnormal breathing; start chest compressions at a ratio of 15:2 with two rescuers or 30:2 with one rescuer, using age-appropriate depth and rate.
Deliver 4 J/kg defibrillation for VF/pulseless VT, resume CPR immediately, give adrenaline after the second shock, and consider amiodarone after the third shock.
For PEA/asystole, continue high-quality CPR, give adrenaline as soon as possible and then every 3–5 minutes, and search for reversible causes.
Focus on basic airway manoeuvres, bag–mask ventilation, early oxygen, and advanced airway only when it does not interrupt compressions.
After ROSC, optimise oxygen and ventilation, maintain normoglycaemia and normothermia, and arrange paediatric ICU care when available.
